intro.para: Here we learn how to compute the determinant of a square shaped matrix: the determinant of a (1,1)-matrix \Mtrx{A} = [x] is just \det [x] := x. From this initial definition we obtain, step by step, the determinants of matrices of size (2,2), then (3,3), then (4,4) and so on. In each case we express the determinant of a big matrix as a sum of determinants of smaller matrices. â€“ The details follow:
